_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 16:40:14 using v2.1
title: How frequently do staff report working extra hours?
analysis_commentary:
One way work pressures may manifest itself, is staff working extra hours (more than 5 hours per week) than they are contracted to do so (either paid or unpaid).

In 2004 and 2005, just over 70% of NHS staff were reporting that they had worked extra hours (both unpaid and paid) than they were contracted to do. This began to steadily fall from 2006, to a low in 2009 of 65% of staff. It then remained static around this proportion until 2011. There was, however, a five percentage point increase in 2012, back up to the 70% mark, which has been sustained in 2013. Ambulance staff consistently report higher values on this indicator that those working in other sectors.
data_source: Department of Health, Survey of NHS Staff
